alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 11 at 8:34PM EST until March 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY REPLACING THE LAKE WIND ADVISORY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, west winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph possible. For the Freeze Watch, expect sub- freezing temperatures in the low to mid 20s. * WHERE...Portions of central South Carolina and east central Georgia. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 1 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday. For the Freeze Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
